title: News regarding ShipCo Logistics
story_body:
ShipCo Logistics Names New Vice President of Customer Experience

ShipCo Logistics Inc. (NYSE: SHIP) announced today the appointment of Jennifer Martinez as Vice President of Customer Experience, effective November 1. Martinez, who previously served as Senior Director of Client Relations at the company, will report directly to Chief Operating Officer Michael Chen.

"Jennifer has consistently demonstrated strong leadership in enhancing our client relationships over the past five years with ShipCo," said Chen in a statement. "Her deep understanding of our customers' needs will be invaluable as we continue to refine our service offerings."

Martinez joined ShipCo in 2019 and has overseen the implementation of several customer feedback initiatives. She holds an MBA from Northwestern University's Kellogg School of Management and previously worked at FedEx and DHL in various operational roles.

In her new position, Martinez will be responsible for overseeing customer service operations across ShipCo's network of 47 distribution centers and managing a team of approximately 200 customer service professionals.

The company also announced its participation in the upcoming Supply Chain Management Conference in Atlanta, scheduled for December 5-7. ShipCo executives will host a booth showcasing the company's digital tracking platform and participate in a panel discussion on last-mile delivery optimization.

Additionally, ShipCo unveiled its "Deliver with Purpose" marketing campaign, which highlights the company's reliability and commitment to on-time delivery. The campaign will include digital advertising and targeted outreach to small and medium-sized businesses across key markets.

As part of its ongoing environmental initiatives, ShipCo reported the installation of LED lighting systems at five additional warehouses in California and Texas. The upgrades are expected to reduce energy consumption by approximately 15% at these facilities, contributing to the company's goal of reducing carbon emissions by 20% by 2030.

ShipCo Logistics operates throughout North America, providing freight forwarding, warehousing, and last-mile delivery services. The company reported revenues of $2.3 billion in its most recent fiscal year.

Shares of SHIP closed at $34.22 on Tuesday, down 0.3% for the day. The stock has traded between $31.50 and $42.75 over the past 52 weeks.
